topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the SSL Certificate Alternate Name Patch

section.p: This patch fixes issue where the baremetal service (Ironic) is not able to use the CAN endpoint. The patch sets the OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE=internalURL variable in the stackrc file that is generated on the HP Helion OpenStack controller nodes. HCG-1116
Note: This patch is for Sacramento deployments only.

body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the bm-endpoint-stackrc.patch and readme files are available.
The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.

ol.li:
Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <HLM_VM_IP>
where: HLM_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the and file to the /~ directory.
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../bm-endpoint-stackrc.patch
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:./hlm_prepare-env.sh
Execute the following command:hlm generate -c <cloud name>
Execute the following command to redeploy the Horizon UI: hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "STACKRC"

section.title: Verify the patch
section.p: SSH to any HP Helion OpenStack controller node and check that the stackrc file is present in the /root/ directory and has an entry for export OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE=internalURL.
